title: Refactor Profile Structure / matching logic
custom_steps:
Tech debt story to represent the work that Zach H. is doing. 



Currently players are represented as a combination of player profile, player, and two mapping tables. Whenever a profile is created all of these must stay in sync in order to retain consistency in our data. This is slightly error-prone and can be refactored.

The goal is to go from 4 objects representing a player to having 1 table represent it. To do so weâ€™ll shift the models focus onto the Profile which we believe represents the basic unit at play in wbc.

Doing so, matching logic will be impacted and will have to change slightly.



AC:

* Everything continues to work as is
** Creating a new Player with and without matches
** Saving Player Profiles

title: As a WBC user I want to see a mobile nav on screen sizes 1023 and under
custom_steps:
Design: https://zpl.io/2GWeyJ3

AC:
* Switch to mobile nav at 1023 instead of 767. (there will not be enough room for all the tabs under 1024)
* Update mobile nav to include the different tournaments in the system, the current or upcoming tournament year should be expanded by default, any others should be collapsed. 
*Add the username and Sign Out link to the mobile nav.  The username section should be expanded by default.

title: Styling for search input
custom_steps:
AC:
The search input on the prospective players tab should be styled like other inputs in the system.

* Border radius, border color, padding and height should be the same as the country select next to it.
* update the font-size of placeholders globally to something smaller.

title: Federation Teams - Arrow and trashcan too close together at certain screen sizes
custom_steps:
AC:
* The trashcan and arrow should always have at least 12px of space between them.  Currently they're almost touching at some screen sizes. See attached screenshots.

title: Federation team dropdown on prospective player list / interest list / roster lists
custom_steps:
As a BOC admin, I want to switch between federation teams that are in a tournament.

h2. AC
# When a federation team is added to a tournament, add them to any relevant team selection dropdowns.

Note this feature was originally part of WBCP-8, but we split it out to not block that story. This should be reviewed and tested as appropriate.

title: UX Improvement for Add Federation Teams Modal
custom_steps:
h2. AC
* Hitting enter when teams have been selected in the multi-select and the dropdown list is not visible should act the same way as using the mouse to click save. 
* While typing to search for countries the user should be able to use the arrow keys to scroll the dropdown list

title: Styling for the user dropdown
custom_steps:
h2. Design: https://zpl.io/2EWN6vY

AC:
* Clicking on the username or arrow will open a popover with a Sign Out link
* The popover should appear directly beneath the arrow.  It's currently left aligned with the username.

title: UI Styling Updates
custom_steps:
AC:
* The hover color on the side and top nav(user dropdown arrow) should be a lighter blue.  #4c8cee
* The section title on the Federation Teams page should read "Tournament(0)" not "Tournaments(0)"
* Hovering over the trophy icon should say "Tournaments"

title: Prospective Player List | Add to Interest List
custom_steps:
As a BOC admin or Federation Admin, I want the ability to add a player to a team's interest list.

## A continue button which will close the modal.

title: Rosters | Create Interest List Tab and Page
custom_steps:
As a BOC admin, I want to view all Federation Teams' interest lists

As a federation admin, I want to view my team's interest list.

h2. AC
# Create a tab in the top nav called "Interest List"
## This tab should be visible to BOC Admins and Federation Users of any type
# At the top of the page, display a heading that says "Interest List" with the country flag to the left of the words.
# For BOC users, display a dropdown that enables the user to select a federation team. Only teams in the current tournament should be visible in the list.
# Display the maximum number of allowed interest list players from the roster settings
# Display a list of players who have been added to the interest list by the federation.

## Last name
## First name
## Position
## Org
## Club

## Eligibility status (no functionality as part of this story)
## IL Flag
## 40 man flag

title: Hide old environment indicator
custom_steps:
AC:
* The only indictor is the one inside the WBC pinwheel logo

title: Unsaved changes page behavior and modal
custom_steps:
As a user, I want to be reminded when I have unsaved changes on a page and attempt to leave the page so that I don't lose my changes.

h2. AC
# When a user is on a page with unsaved changes and they attempt to leave the page, display a modal.
# The modal should use the language that's in the design.
# Clicking "save changes" will save the changes from the page, close the modal, throw a green success notification "Saved" and navigate the user to where they were trying to go.
# Clicking "discard changes" will discard the changes and take the user to where they originally tried to navigate.

h2. Design
https://zpl.io/bz6K7Oz

title: Display EBIS fields on profile when profile is linked to EBIS
custom_steps:
As a user, I want to see EBIS fields on the player profile when it is linked to EBIS.

h2. AC
If a player profile is linked to an EBIS ID, display the following fields

# EBIS ID (not editable, not visible if player is not linked to an EBIS ID) 
# 40 man roster (not editable, not visible if player is not linked to an EBIS ID) - Yes/No
# IL (not editable, not visible if player is not linked to an EBIS ID) - Yes/No
# Suspended List (not editable,  not visible if player is not linked to an EBIS ID) - Yes/No

title: UI Styling Updates
custom_steps:
* Logo: The blue part of the pinwheel should line up with the bottom of the top nav
* The left nav and top subnav color should be #1e376d
* The left and top nav are missing the box-shadows.  Note: the box-shadow settings for each are different.
* Clicking the user dropdown for the first time doesnâ€™t work, only works on second click(this was an issue in other projects)
* There looks to be a container div with a background color set to white thatâ€™s unnecessary.  The scrollbar panes are also showing on this div.  Itâ€™s most obvious in the tournaments section of the app right now.
* The page borders in the app should be #d2d2d2, see federation teams page for example. 
* Styling of disable buttons is incorrect (see settings page)
* Size of the header buttons is incorrect
*  The settings and trophy icon color should be #0083c0

title: Getting XML code when reloading main landing page
custom_steps: After logging into WBC, if I reload the landing page I get XML code. This is happening on Chrome and Safari.

title: Add Individual Player | Add player by EBIS ID Form

As a BOC Admin or Federation Admin, I want to add a prospective player to my list by using their EBIS ID so that they appear on my prospective player list.

Creating an EBIS Player: https://zpl.io/aw6BoqN

title: Add Individual Player Form | Add player by name process
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin or Federation Admin, I want to add a prospective player to my list by using their name, date of birth and birth country so that they appear on my prospective player list.

h2. AC
# Using the form created in WBCP-28 and the name/dob/country radio button is selected
# Make the field background color white
# Confirm that all three fields have values before enabling the create player button
# Perform a matching check against the list of players in the WBC player database. There are three outcomes:

## *Player match against this federation's player list*
### Display the player match modal for this federation https://zpl.io/aMRKekN
#### Clicking interest list adds the matched profile to the team's interest list
#### Clicking Continue Creating New Player will take them to a profile form to continue adding the player. Name, DOB, birth country should be pre-filled.
#### Clicking cancel closes the modal
## *Player match against another federation's player list*
### Display the player match modal for other federation players https://zpl.io/anLdxNl
#### Clicking Create Profile will create a new version of that players profile for the federation and take them to the profile to continue creating their version of the player.
#### Clicking Continue Creating New Player will take them to a profile form to continue adding the player. Name, DOB, birth country should be pre-filled.
#### Clicking cancel closes the modal


h2. Designs
Prospective Players: https://zpl.io/VOx9Ndl
Creating a player by name: https://zpl.io/VQvxmRW (Adding a match to your interest list)

title: General Roster Settings
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin, I want to control the roster limits for a tournament so that rosters are abiding by the tournament rules.

h2. AC
# Add a section settings page created in WBCP-6
## The section should be called "General Roster Settings"
## The section should have a stylized heading called "General Roster Settings"
## The section will have an expand/collapse icon. Clicking should expand/collapse as appropriate.
## The section should be expanded by default.
# The section should contain the following setting.
## Federation Interest List Max Players
## Default value is 50
## Only numerical values are allowed
# When the form has changed, display an asterisk at the top of the page next to the year (https://zpl.io/brMkBAO) and activate the save and cancel buttons.
## Clicking save saves the settings and displays the green "saved" notification on the page (https://zpl.io/awJd8oM)
## Clicking cancel reverts the settings back to their previous values and makes the form "clean" again.


h2. Design
System Settings: https://zpl.io/aw6oonM

title: Federation Teams Modal Actions
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin, I want the ability to add federation teams to a tournament year so that the teams are available to federations for roster management.

h2. AC
# On the tournament management page created in WBCP-7, add an action to the "Add Federation Teams" button. This action triggers a modal.
# The modal should have an "Add Federation Teams" header.
# The modal should have an "X". Clicking the "X" will close the modal.
# The modal will have a searchable multi-select input.
## Typing a country name will display a list of potential matches
## Selecting a result will add it to the input 
## The user should be able to click enter to add an option when it's highlighted.  after clicking enter the field should still be in focus so the user can continue searching for options.
## Only valid results can be added to the input field
## Clicking the "X" next to the result will remove it from the input
# The modal will have an Add Teams button
## The Add Teams button will not activate until there is at least one valid result in the input field.
## Clicking Add Teams will add the team(s) in the input field to the tournament section relative to where the Add Teams button was clicked (Qualifying or main tournament)
## The modal should close and the save/cancel button in the header should become active(if not already) (https://zpl.io/awJd8oM)
# There will be a cancel button that is always active. Clicking the cancel button will close the modal.
-When a federation team is added to a tournament, add them to any relevant team selection dropdowns-
-When a federation team is added, unhide the roster tabs for federation users.-

*Design:* https://zpl.io/amdRoP9

title: Player Matching | EBIS Matching by name/dob/country
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin or Federation Team admin, I want to know when a player matches in EBIS so that I can link the profile.

h2. AC
# When adding a player, perform a match against EBIS for first name, last name, dob
# If there is a match, display the EBIS Match modal
# Data to display in the table
## EBIS ID
## Last name
## First name
## Ext Last
## Middle initial
## Birth Country
## Birth Date
# Clicking the cancel button closes the modal
# Clicking the "+ Link EBIS Profile" icon:
## Adds the player to the prospective player list
## Links the WBC profile to the EBIS profile 
## Adds the following data from EBIS to the player's WBC Profile
### Height
### Weight
### Bats / Throws
### Org
### Club
### IL Days
### 40 man roster flag
### Birth Date
### Birth Country
### Birth State
### Birth City
### Primary Address
### Primary Email address and Type
### Primary Phone number, country code and Type
### Primary Address type and address
## Closes the modal
## Takes the user to a filled out profile page
## Displays the green "Profile Linked" confirmation message.
# Clicking cancel cancels the match
# Clicking no match, create new profile button takes the user to the profile page to continue entering a new prospect manually.

*Design:* 
https://zpl.io/25AG7Kn
https://zpl.io/VQvxmRW

title: Add Individual Player | Add player by EBIS ID Match
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin or Federation Team admin, I want to know when a player matches in EBIS when I add a player by EBIS ID, so that I can link to their EBIS profile.

h2. AC

h3. When adding a player by EBIS ID, first check to see if a player with that EBIS ID already exists in the WBC portal.

h4. Player with EBIS ID exists on this team
# Show the WBC team match modal https://zpl.io/aMRKekN
# If the user clicks add to interest list 
## Add the player to the interest list 
## Take the user back to the prospective player lists and display a confirmation message.
# If the user clicks cancel, take the user back to the PP list

h4. Player with EBIS ID exists on another WBC team
# Show the WBC team other match modal. https://zpl.io/anLdxNl
# If the user clicks add to PP list 
## Create a new profile for that player for this team 
## Take the user to the profile page so they can make any edits.
# If the user clicks cancel, take the user back to the PP list 

h3. If the player does not exist in the WBC portal, then perform matching against EBIS for the EBIS ID

h4. Player with EBIS ID does not exist in WBC Portal
# Check EBIS for the entered ID
# If there is no match, tell the user that no player with that ID exists in EBIS https://zpl.io/bJWm6QE
# If there is a match, display the EBIS ID matching modal https://zpl.io/2EWP5jn
# If a user clicks import profile, 
## Create a profile for that player in WBC
## Link to the EBIS profile 
## Take the user to the profile page so the admin can make any additional changes.
# If the user clicks cancel, take the user back to the PP list 

h3. EBIS profile data to import
# Height
# Weight
# Bats / Throws
# Org
# Club
# IL Days
# 40 man roster flag
# Birth Date
# Birth Country
# Birth State
# Birth City
# Primary Address
# Primary Email address and Type

title: Player Matching | WBC Portal Match Modal Display
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin or Federation Admin, I want to know when a player I am adding matches a player that already exists in a federation team's prospective player list so that I do not create an additional profile.

h2. AC
# Check the data entered vs. the WBC player database.
# There are two types of matches
## Match vs. this team's list
## Match vs. other team's player list
# If there is a match, display the matching modal
# Modal header "The info entered matches existing player(s)
# X Column table, where X depends on the number of matches
## field names
## you entered
## Interest list icon (for each matched profile)
# Data to display
## Last name, first name
## Birth Country
## Birth Date
## Federations (for other team matching only)
# Clicking "No, continue creating player" will take the user to the profile page to fill out the form.
# Clicking "Cancel" will close the matching window.

h2. Out of scope from design
# Clicking the +Interest List button will add the player to the interest list


*Design:*
Player on own federation list: https://zpl.io/aMRKekN
Player on other federationâ€™s list: https://zpl.io/anLdxNl

title: As a BOC Admin, I would like to see a list of all WBC Users
custom_steps:
Log in as BOC Admin
Click to user administration page
See list of users by their federation 
See the role that the users are assigned within WBC
User roles are stored in WBC Database
User list is also stored in LDAP for authentication purposes

User management / Permissions management are handled in separate stories

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the ability to register a user in LDAP
custom_steps:
*NOTE: This story is a work in progress, and may be updated/closed*

In order for a user to get authenticated, they need to be registered in LDAP. They can self-reg, but if processes change, a BOC Admin may be able to initiate that registration process for a particular user.

*AC:*

* The admin or user will enter the userâ€™s email in self reg
* If the LDAP account does not yet exist, they input the userâ€™s name, email, selected role, and other metadata.
* LDAP WBC Admin can then go to user administration and retrieve list of pending users
* WBC Admin can approve the user and assign the role of BOC Administrator, WBC Federation Admin, or WBC Federation user. The user is then added to the wbc-users group in LDAP and the appropriate role group - wbc-boc-admin, wbc-fed-team-admin, wbc-fed-team-user
* The user would appear in the list of users within WBC. A WBC admin can then assign a federation for the user

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the ability to update/remove a user from a particular federation team
custom_steps:
BOC Admins should have the ability to change an assigned user's mapping to a federation team, or remove a user's mapping entirely.

*AC*:
* Using a separate page/tab, see a table of users and the team(s) they are assigned for.
* Maybe even see what _role_ said user has in LDAP (so 2-3 columns)
* In the column with the fed team, it can default to empty. An admin can select the fed team from the dropdown
* There would be a fourth column for a delete button.
* By hitting â€œConfirmâ€￾, the mapping of user to fed team is â€œdeletedâ€￾ if they hit the delete button, or if they changed the team in the dropdown, then hitting confirm would change the user's team mapping.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the ability to assign a user to a specific federation team
custom_steps:
BOC Admins need the ability to assign a registered user to a particular federation.

*AC*:
* Using a separate page/tab, see a table of users and the team(s) they are assigned for.
* Maybe even see what _role_ said user has in LDAP (so 2-3 columns)
* In the column with the fed team, it can default to empty. An admin can select the fed team from the dropdown.
* By hitting â€œConfirmâ€￾, the user is assigned to a particular Fed team

title: As a WBC user I want to know whether I've entered a valid email address or not
custom_steps:
Design: https://zpl.io/VQQAAyn

AC:
* If a valid email address has been entered a green checkmark will display next to the email field and the red outline will go away
* If an invalid email address has been entered a red x will display next to the email field and the message "invalid format" will display above the field

title: As a WBC user I want a close button on the profile if no changes have been made
custom_steps:
AC:
* If no changes have been made to the profile show an enabled close button instead of a disabled cancel button
* If changes have been made show a enabled cancel button and hide the close button
* Clicking close takes the user back to their point of entry.  (If the user clicked on the player name from the interest list they should go back to that tab and not just back to the first tab)

title: Player Profile Form - Info Tab
custom_steps:
As a BOC admin or Federation Admin, I want the ability to view and edit a player profile so that their information is always up to date.

As a Federation User, I want the ability to view a profile so that I can see the information about a specific player.

h2. AC
# On the info tab, create the player info form
# The BOC admin will see a dropdown which will enable them to switch back and forth between views if the player is on the prospective player list of multiple teams
# The profile will have four sections and respective fields
## Bio Information
### First Name
### Last Name
### Birth Date
### Birth Country
### Birth State
### Birth CIty
## Contact Information
### Phone Type (Mobile, Home, Other)
### Country Code (dropdown of countries)
### Phone Number
### Email Type (Personal, Other)
### Email Address
## Baseball Information
### Org
### Club
### Position
### Height
### Weight
### Bats
### Throws
## Address
### Address type (Home, Other)
### Country
### Street Address 1
### Street Address 2
### Street Address 3
### City
### State
### ZIP Code
# When the form is clean, the save and cancel buttons are greyed out.
# When the form is dirty, the save and cancel buttons are active. 
## Clicking save saves the form
## Clicking cancel closes the form
# When the form is dirty, display an asterisk icon next to the info tab.
# All fields are required except org and club name.
# After a profile is created, First name, last name, birth country and DOB will be locked from editing.

h2. Data Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/BES/Data+Discovery

h2. Designs
Ebis Player: https://zpl.io/brMyMMe
Non-ebis player: https://zpl.io/aNDkDWD
Unsaved Changes UX: https://zpl.io/brMkBAO
Saving Changes UX: https://zpl.io/V45xLD4

title: Prospective Player List | Add New Player Form
custom_steps:
As a BOC administrator or Federation Administrator, I want to add players to my prospective players list on an individual basis.

h2. AC
# On the prospective player screen add the "New Player" form
# The form will have a create player button that executes the form as outlined below depending on how the user interacts with the form.
# The form will have two radio buttons with separate functionality
## First name, last name, birth country, DOB (all required fields if that method is chosen)
## EBIS ID (required field if that method is chosen)
# The form will have a create player button (disabled until all required fields have been filled in)
# Clicking the create player will execute the form submission which will be discussed in separate stories.
# The create player button is not active until the form is filled out

title: Create Prospective Player List Page
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin or Federation Admin or Federation User, I want the ability to see and manage my prospective player lists.

h2. AC
# A BOC admin will have a dropdown that allows them to switch between Federation teams.
## The dropdown should only display teams that have been added to a tournament via the manage tournament screen.
## Sort the countries in the dropdown by alpha descending
# All users who can access this page will see a search bar. Typing the name of a user will filter the list with relevant results.
# Show a list of all prospective players for that federation. Each player will have the following columns. 
## An "add" icon which will add the player to the federation interest list roster stage (for this story, this button has no action)
## Last name
## First name
## Ext Last
## Middle Name
## Pos
## Bats/Throws
## Org
## Club
## Ebis ID
## IL Days
## 40 man flag
## Birth Date
## Birth Country
